hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Regime Fade on Failed Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market is in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 60%) and experiences a sharp 1-day volatility compression (BTC 14-day ATR < 2.5%) followed by a failed upside breakout (price fails to hold above 1.5% gain from compression low), a short position will be profitable as the market transitions to a BEAR regime within 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Failed breakouts from low volatility environments in neutral regimes often signal institutional distribution and lack of follow-through. The failed test of resistance creates selling pressure as weak longs exit, accelerating a transition to bearish sentiment.
entry_conditions: Price breaks above compression high by >1% intraday
Price closes below compression high (failed breakout)
Volume on breakout day < 20-day average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5% profit OR regime shifts to BEAR (confidence > 65%)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of signals result in immediate continuation above compression high leading to BULL regime instead of BEAR.
